
Prerequisites
==============

Nodejs 4.2.0
==============
  To make selenium work, a node version of at least 4.2.0 is required.
  Otherwise, some new ECMAScrip 2015 key words are not known and JS will not be compliant

Required npm modules
====================  
Install selenium-webdriver and mocha framework by "npm install" in this directory

Browser drivers
================
* Chrome
  https://sites.google.com/a/chromium.org/chromedriver/
  Download driver executeable, and put into your PATH
  There is one version in \node_modules\syracuse-tablet\test\autoUI\drivers\windows\chrome that can also be used
  
* Edge
  https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=48212
  Edge driver, msi that has to be set up
  
* iOS:
  http://ios-driver.github.io/ios-driver/
  

Running a test
==============
Ensure the mocha bin directory (./node_modules/mocha/bin) is in your PATH

To launch all tests and log into testResult.html (Will use chrome by default):
npm test

To launch a single lest using a specific browser and log to the console:
set BROWSER_ENV=chrome&&node ./node_modules/mocha/bin/mocha --reporter spec tests/welcomePageTest

To launch one or more tests using the html reporter:
set BROWSER_ENV=chrome&&node ./node_modules/mocha/bin/mocha --reporter lib/htmlReporter tests/welcomePageTest
